item.title: How we're using gossip to improve Cortex and Loki availability
item.description: Have you heard about using the hash ring in Loki and Cortex? Here is a short version: In Cortex and Loki, the ring is a space divided by tokens into smaller segments. Each segment belongs to a single “ingester” (component in Cortex and Loki that receives data) and is used to shard series/logs across multiple ingesters. In addition to the tokens, each ingester also has an entry with its ID, address, and the latest heartbeat timestamp updated periodically.

item.title: Letter to our customers: Grafana Labs and COVID-19
item.description: As COVID-19 has spread across the world over recent months, upending life as we know it, we have all been watching the situation closely – both on a business level and a personal one. So first and foremost, we hope that this communication finds you and your loved ones safe and healthy. At the same time, we want to reassure you that Grafana Labs continues to operate at full capacity. We have always been a completely distributed, remote-first team – from our software engineers to our sales representatives – so the business world’s sudden forced transition to working from home has had little impact on our operations.

item.title: Introducing Grafana Cloud Agent, a remote_write-focused Prometheus agent that can save 40% on memory usage
item.description: Today, we are announcing the Grafana Cloud Agent, a subset of Prometheus built for hosted metrics that runs lean on memory and uses much of the same battle-tested code that has made Prometheus so awesome. At Grafana Labs, we love Prometheus. We deploy it for our internal monitoring, use it alongside Alertmanager, and have it configured to send its data to Cortex via remote_write. Unfortunately, as we scale to handle more than 4 million active series in a single Prometheus, our deployment becomes more and more difficult to manage.

item.title: How to work from home with kids: More tips from the remote-first Grafana Labs team
item.description: Last week we posted tips from our remote-first Grafana Labs team on how to work from home effectively. Why would we write another? Kids. All around the world, schools, kindergartens, pre-schools, daycares, and every other place that keeps kids occupied are closing, and that means many people are not only adapting to a home office, but they’re also taking on homeschooling and home care as well. All while also worrying about elderly, weak-of-heart, immunocompromised, or otherwise at-risk loved ones.

item.title: Watch talks on Cortex vs. Thanos, Metrictank past and present, and a preview of Grafana 7 from our recent meetup
item.description: Check out the latest meetup we hosted in Tel Aviv, Israel, together with longtime Grafana users, Taboola! It has been a little while since we organized a meetup in Tel-Aviv – 2016 to be exact – so we decided it was a fine time to get back to this beautiful city. Taboola were kind enough to host the Grafana meetup at their wonderful offices in the Atrium tower for an afternoon of metrics, logs, traces, and good times!
